question: Fingolimod is a selective antagonist for which molecule?
ideal_answer: Fingolimod is a selective S1P1 functional antagonist by induction of irreversible S1P1 internalization and degradation.

snippets.text: Pharmacologically, fingolimod was characterized as a non-selective agonist of all of the S1P receptors (S1PR), with the exception of S1P2, and in addition, as a selective S1P1 functional antagonist by induction of irreversible S1P1 internalization and degradation.
